title: Magnetic bead-based TREG-TEFF cell isolation from PBMC with Miltenyi CD4+CD25+ Regulatory T cell Isolation Kit
title_html: Magnetic bead-based TREG-TEFF cell isolation from PBMC with Miltenyi CD4+CD25+ Regulatory T cell Isolation Kit

creator.affiliation: Center for Research in Medical Pharmacology, University of Insubria

source.description: Isolate PBMCs according to the standard protocol "Separation and purification of human PBMC from BUFFY COAT" or "Separation and purification of human PBMC from FRESH BLOOD"

OPTIONAL STEP
Sorting of TREG is quite long procedure. Especially in clinical studies with whole blood of enrolled subject, it is possible to stop it after PBMC isolation and counting.
In this case, put cells in a flask with complete medium at a concentration of 1x106 cells/mL.
Put the flasks in an incubator (37°C, 5% CO2), and start sorting procedure the day after.

Centrifuge the obtained PBMCs at 
. 
Aspirate supernatant completely. (Use 15 mL-conical tube)

source.body:
Work fast, keep cells cold, and use pre-cooled solutions. This will prevent capping of antibodies on the cell surface and non-specific cell labeling.
Volumes for magnetic labeling indicated in this procedure are for up to 10x106 total PBMCs. When working with higher than 10x106 cells, scale up all reagent volumes and total volumes accordingly.      
For optimal performance it is important to obtain a single-cell suspension before magnetic labeling.

source.description:
Resuspend the pellet in 
of cold Miltenyi Buffer (for 10x106 cells).

source.title: Miltenyi Buffer

Prepare column by rinsing it with 
of Miltenyi Buffer (trash the effluent).

source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ehl8","text":"This recipe is used in the following protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5hpmp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3uduj","text":"Magnetic bead-based TREG-TEFF cell isolation from PBMC with Miltenyi CD4+CD25+ Regulatory T cell Isolation Kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":110,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
Apply cell suspension onto the column.

Collect unlabeled cells that pass through column. Wait until the column reservoir is completely empty.
Wash again 2 times with 
of cold Miltenyi Buffer and 1 last time with
of Buffer.
Collect total effluent that is consisting of unlabeled pre-enriched CD4+ cell fraction.

Centrifuge the obtained effluent at

Remove supernatant and resuspend cell pellet in 
of cold Miltenyi Buffer (for 10x106 cells).

source.body:
Use 15 mL-conical tubes.
Volumes for magnetic labeling indicated in this procedure are for an initial starting cell number of up to 10x106 total PBMCs. For higher initial cell numbers, scale up all reagent volumes accordingly.

source.body: Magnetic separation: Positive selection of CD4+CD25+T regulatory cells.

source.description:
Prepare the column by rinsing with 
of cold Miltenyi Bufferand trash the effluent.

source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ehl8","text":"This recipe is used in the following protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5hpmp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3uduj","text":"Magnetic bead-based TREG-TEFF cell isolation from PBMC with Miltenyi CD4+CD25+ Regulatory T cell Isolation Kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":110,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
Apply cell suspension onto the column.

Collect the flow-through containing unlabeled negative fraction (T effector cells CD25-).
Wait until the column reservoir is completely empty, wash again 3 times with 
of cold Miltenyi Buffer.
Remove the column from the magnet and place it on a suitable collection tube.

Pipette 
of cold Buffer onto the column.
Immediately flush out the magnetically labeled cells by firmly pushing the plunger into the column.
The cells that are flushed out are CD25 labeled cells positive fraction (T regulatory cells CD25+).

source.title: Miltenyi Buffer

source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ehl8","text":"This recipe is used in the following protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5hpmp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3uduj","text":"Magnetic bead-based TREG-TEFF cell isolation from PBMC with Miltenyi CD4+CD25+ Regulatory T cell Isolation Kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":110,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
In order to make sure that collection of cells was complete, repeat the last step TWO more times.
Centrifuge isolated TEFF and TREG at

Resuspend TEFF cells in 
of RPMI/10%FBS and TREG cells in 
of RPMI/10%FBS.
Count them under microscope or Cellometer machine, according to the appropriate procedure (see step 2 of this protocol).
(
See this link for RPMI-FBS 10% recipe
)

OPTIONAL STEPS
If required, it is possible to check the purity of isolated TEFF and TREG.
Proceed as follows:
    Centrifuge at 
    Remove the supernatant and resuspend the pellet in 
    PBS 1X ;
    Add the adequate antibodies such as: CD4 APC-Cy7 (
    , BD cat. n. 557871), CD25 PE (
    , Miltenyi cat. n. 120-001-311) and CD127 AF647 (
    , BD cat. n. 558598) or conjugated to other fluorochromes;
    Incubate for 
    , in the dark, at RT;
    Wash with 
    of PBS 1X and centrifuge
    ;
    Resuspend the pellet in
    PBS 1X and leave on ice until FACS acquisition with an appropriate protocol.

1.44 g (10 mM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":7,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2rtbf","text":"KH2PO4 - 0.24 g (1.8 mM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1aiq9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2nh4k","text":"To prepare 1 L of PBS 1X, dissolve the reagents listed above in 800 mL of ultrapure H2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9d7ao","text":"Adjust the pH to 7.4 with HCl or NaOH, and then add H2O to 1 L.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1vrqp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8epja","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a05d8","text":"NaCl code: S9625, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":10,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dl8qu","text":"KCl code: P9541, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"19msp","text":"Na2HPO4 code: 1.06585, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4cko6","text":"KH2PO4 code: P0662, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3f8u5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cmlsp","text":"Fonte: (Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory Press 2006)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":49,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"389h","text":"This recepe is used in the following protocols:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1l0m1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8ginf","text":"- Separation and purification of human PBMC from FRESH BLOOD","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d21r8","text":"- Separation and purification of human PBMC from BUFFY COAT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a1haj","text":"- Magnetic bead-based CD4+ T cell isolation from PBMCs with Dynabeads: CD4 Positive Isolation Kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b9f3g","text":"- Magnetic bead-based TREG-TEFF cell isolation from PBMC with Miltenyi CD4+CD25+ Regulatory T cell Isolation Kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b700","text":"- Staining of human PBMC or ISOLATED SUBSETS with Cell Proliferation Dye-eFluor\u2122 670 (CPD-eFluor670) for cell proliferation evaluation by Flow Cytometry","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

Determine the cell number and viability with the microscope by staining with either Türk or Trypan blue. You can use also Cellometer machine. (PBMC purity should be ≥95% with few contaminant PMNs to prevent clogging of the column)
.
For manual cell count use Türk solution for checking purity.
Mix 10 µl of cell suspention with an equal amount of Türk solution (dilution factor = 2), allow mixture 3 min at room temperature.
Take 10 µl of the mixture and place it inside a Bürker chamber and view under an optical microscope using 40X magnification.
Count the cells in each square found in the four corners and in the central square (see figure 1 below), including those
that lie on the bottom and left-hand perimeters, but not those that lie on the top and right hand perimeters (see figure
2 below).
Total number of cells per ml = mean number of cells x dilution factor x 104 (hemacytometer volume).
Figure 1
The gridded area of the chamber consists of nine 1 mmq squares. These squares are subdivided in three directions; 0.0625 mmq, 0.05 mmq and 0.04 mmq. The central square here in Figure 1 is further subdivided into 0.0025 mmq = 1/25 mmq squares. Count cells in 5 squares as shown.
Figure 2
Concerning those cells that lay on the perimeter of the square, count following this scheme.
For automatic cell count with Cellometer machine use Trypan Blue.
The machine will calculate the n°of cells/ml and the % of viability.
Take 10 µl of cell suspention and add an equal amount of Trypan Blue. Use all the volume to place it in a counting chamber. Place the chamber inside Cellometer and count.

source.title: Türk solution and Trypan Blue
